00021 #ifndef _STDINT_H
00022 #define _STDINT_H
00023 #include <stddef.h>
00024 
00025 /* 7.18.1.1  Exact-width integer types */
00026 typedef signed char        int8_t;
00027 typedef unsigned char      uint8_t;
00028 typedef signed short       int16_t;
00029 typedef unsigned short     uint16_t;
00030 typedef signed long        int32_t;
00031 typedef unsigned long      uint32_t;
00032 typedef signed long long   int64_t;
00033 typedef unsigned long long uint64_t;
00034 
00035 /* 7.18.1.2  Minimum-width integer types */
00036 typedef signed char        int_least8_t;
00037 typedef unsigned char      uint_least8_t;
00038 typedef signed short       int_least16_t;
00039 typedef unsigned short     uint_least16_t;
00040 typedef signed long        int_least32_t;
00041 typedef unsigned long      uint_least32_t;
00042 typedef signed long long   int_least64_t;
00043 typedef unsigned long long uint_least64_t;
00044 
00045 /*  7.18.1.3  Fastest minimum-width integer types
00046  *  Not actually guaranteed to be fastest for all purposes
00047  *  Here we use the exact-width types for 8 and 16-bit ints.
00048  */
00049 typedef signed char        int_fast8_t;
00050 typedef unsigned char      uint_fast8_t;
00051 typedef signed short       int_fast16_t;
00052 typedef unsigned short     uint_fast16_t;
00053 typedef signed long        int_fast32_t;
00054 typedef unsigned long      uint_fast32_t;
00055 typedef signed long long   int_fast64_t;
00056 typedef unsigned long long uint_fast64_t;
00057 
00058 /* 7.18.1.4  Integer types capable of holding object pointers */
00059 // Already defined by IAR, and differs between specific devices.
00060 //typedef signed int         intptr_t;
00061 //typedef unsigned           uintptr_t;
00062 
00063 /* 7.18.1.5  Greatest-width integer types */
00064 typedef signed long long   intmax_t;
00065 typedef unsigned long long uintmax_t;
00066 
00067 /* 7.18.2  Limits of specified-width integer types */
00068 #if !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined (__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS)
00069 
00070 /* 7.18.2.1  Limits of exact-width integer types */
00071 #define INT8_MIN (-128)
00072 #define INT16_MIN (-32768)
00073 #define INT32_MIN (-2147483647 - 1)
00074 #define INT64_MIN  (-9223372036854775807LL - 1)
00075 
00076 #define INT8_MAX 127
00077 #define INT16_MAX 32767
00078 #define INT32_MAX 2147483647
00079 #define INT64_MAX 9223372036854775807LL
00080 
00081 #define UINT8_MAX 0xff /* 255U */
00082 #define UINT16_MAX 0xffff /* 65535U */
00083 #define UINT32_MAX 0xffffffff  /* 4294967295U */
00084 #define UINT64_MAX 0xffffffffffffffffULL /* 18446744073709551615ULL */
00085 
00086 /* 7.18.2.2  Limits of minimum-width integer types */
00087 #define INT_LEAST8_MIN INT8_MIN
00088 #define INT_LEAST16_MIN INT16_MIN
00089 #define INT_LEAST32_MIN INT32_MIN
00090 #define INT_LEAST64_MIN INT64_MIN
00091 
00092 #define INT_LEAST8_MAX INT8_MAX
00093 #define INT_LEAST16_MAX INT16_MAX
00094 #define INT_LEAST32_MAX INT32_MAX
00095 #define INT_LEAST64_MAX INT64_MAX
00096 
00097 #define UINT_LEAST8_MAX UINT8_MAX
00098 #define UINT_LEAST16_MAX UINT16_MAX
00099 #define UINT_LEAST32_MAX UINT32_MAX
00100 #define UINT_LEAST64_MAX UINT64_MAX
00101 
00102 /* 7.18.2.3  Limits of fastest minimum-width integer types */
00103 #define INT_FAST8_MIN INT8_MIN
00104 #define INT_FAST16_MIN INT16_MIN
00105 #define INT_FAST32_MIN INT32_MIN
00106 #define INT_FAST64_MIN INT64_MIN
00107 
00108 #define INT_FAST8_MAX INT8_MAX
00109 #define INT_FAST16_MAX INT16_MAX
00110 #define INT_FAST32_MAX INT32_MAX
00111 #define INT_FAST64_MAX INT64_MAX
00112 
00113 #define UINT_FAST8_MAX UINT8_MAX
00114 #define UINT_FAST16_MAX UINT16_MAX
00115 #define UINT_FAST32_MAX UINT32_MAX
00116 #define UINT_FAST64_MAX UINT64_MAX
00117 
00118 /* 7.18.2.4  Limits of integer types capable of holding
00119     object pointers */
00120 #define INTPTR_MIN INT32_MIN
00121 #define INTPTR_MAX INT32_MAX
00122 #define UINTPTR_MAX UINT32_MAX
00123 
00124 /* 7.18.2.5  Limits of greatest-width integer types */
00125 #define INTMAX_MIN INT64_MIN
00126 #define INTMAX_MAX INT64_MAX
00127 #define UINTMAX_MAX UINT64_MAX
00128 
00129 /* 7.18.3  Limits of other integer types */
00130 #define PTRDIFF_MAX ((ptrdiff_t)-1)
00131 #define PTRDIFF_MIN (-PTRDIFF_MAX)
00132 
00133 #define SIZE_MAX ((size_t)-1)
00134 
00135 /* --- The following are also defined in IAR's wchar.h file ---
00136 #ifndef WCHAR_MIN 
00137 #define WCHAR_MIN 0
00138 #define WCHAR_MAX ((wchar_t)-1)
00139 #endif
00140 */
00141 
00142 #endif /* !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined __STDC_LIMIT_MACROS */

00144 
00145 /* 7.18.4  Macros for integer constants */
00146 #if !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined (__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS)
00147 
00148 /* 7.18.4.1  Macros for minimum-width integer constants */
00149 #define INT8_C(val) ((int8_t) + (val))
00150 #define UINT8_C(val) ((uint8_t) + (val##U))
00151 #define INT16_C(val) ((int16_t) + (val))
00152 #define UINT16_C(val) ((uint16_t) + (val##U))
00153 
00154 #define INT32_C(val) (val##L)
00155 #define UINT32_C(val) (val##UL)
00156 #define INT64_C(val) (val##LL)
00157 #define UINT64_C(val) (val##ULL)
00158 
00159 /* 7.18.4.2  Macros for greatest-width integer constants */
00160 #define INTMAX_C(val)  INT64_C(val)
00161 #define UINTMAX_C(val) UINT64_C(val)
00162 
00163 #endif  /* !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS */
00164 
00165 #endif
